bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to William F. Wharton, August 4, 1890
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, August 4th, 1890
Mer. B. Y. Payne To the Deartment of State.
Honorable William F. Wharton, Ass't Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.

Sir. I have the honor respectfully to transmit herewith, the Accounts and returns of the Agent at Elmina, for the quarter ending March 21st and June 30th 1890, as follows. Three (3) copies of Arrivals and Departures of American Vessels. Two (2) copies of Summary of Business. One (1) copy of Detailed Report of Official service rendered. One (1) copy Digest of Invoice Book.
I have to regret on account of the late arrival of these Reuturns Returns
Returns at this Consulate, that I could not forward them earlier.
I have the honor to be Sir, Your obedient servant.
Beverly Y. Payne Vice Consul Gen.
